feature_name: Startup check-in opt-in and launch-lane cross-flow wiring
scope_summary: Make startup state check-in open only on user action, add an explicit launch lane that links tasks to focus and sidekick coaching, and ship updated hub beta bundle references so task/focus/sidekick interactions work as one connected flow.

legal_and_regulatory.rationale: The change is UX behavior and copy-level control flow only, with no new legal disclosures or policy collection paths required.
evidence: No new terms, consent scopes, or account requirements introduced
Changes are limited to startup modal behavior and in-app route/action wiring

privacy_local_first_promise.rationale: All new interactions remain local-first and reuse existing in-app state/chat storage with no added network destinations.
evidence: Today launch lane opens existing local sidekick drawer and local task/focus routes
No new fetch calls, APIs, trackers, or third-party endpoints were added

medical_scope_and_claims.rationale: State check-in remains framed as productivity support calibration and does not claim diagnosis or treatment outcomes.
evidence: Top bar guidance says state tuning affects focus/sidekick intensity
Existing non-medical disclaimers remain in hub/footer surfaces

behavioral_science_alignment.rationale: Moving the check-in to user-initiated entry reduces forced friction at startup while keeping fast access to support-state tuning.
evidence: Shell no longer auto-opens check-in modal on load
Top bar now surfaces a clear call to action when check-in is due

neurodivergence_research_alignment.rationale: The launch lane supports chunking and immediate next-step execution, aligning with low-friction, cue-based activation patterns for ND workflows.
evidence: Launch lane anchors the day to one task and routes directly into focus
Sidekick prompt generation now starts from the current anchor task

user_benefit_and_harm_check.rationale: Users gain clearer control over startup UI and tighter cross-feature transitions; foreseeable harm is low and mostly limited to changed first-run expectation.
evidence: Check-in is still one click away instead of forced blocking modal
Focus timer now supports mark-done and sidekick debrief actions

brand_voice_and_claims.rationale: Language remains direct, practical, and non-shaming while preserving existing Divergify framing.
evidence: New labels use concise action verbs: Open check-in, Start sprint, Ask sidekick
No exaggerated performance or health claims were introduced

accessibility_and_inclusion.rationale: Replacing forced startup modal behavior with explicit controls improves user agency and lowers immediate cognitive load.
evidence: Check-in opens via an explicit button with clear intent
Launch lane offers clear, sequential actions instead of hidden route jumps

security_and_reliability.rationale: Bundle references and service worker precache entries were updated together to avoid stale-asset mismatches after deploy.
evidence: Hub and route entry HTML files now point to the same new JS/CSS bundle names
hub/beta/sw.js precache entries updated to new asset filenames

monetization_and_dark_pattern_check.rationale: No payment, upsell, or monetization flow was introduced or altered.

ship_decision.conditions: Ship and verify startup no longer forces the check-in window, then confirm Launch lane buttons open Focus and Sidekick flows as expected.
